summary: The name is self explanatory. This mod makes you grow as you get old!
descriptionHtml:
[Color=yellow]Introduction[/color]
I\'ve always been bothered by the fact that Skyrim doesn\'t let you chose if you will be a fully-grown adult or a still-growing person. This mod allows you to be the last one.

[color=yellow]Description[/color]
Grow as you get old is pretty self-explanatory. It allows your character to grow as you get older (more precisely as you level up).
At the moment you cannot customize any value but it will come in a future update.
For the moment you will start with a scale of 0.97 to look like a teenager or a little person, and after growing completely your scale should be 1.1 to look like a tall and strong warrior, or simply a tall person. 
To become fully-grown, it takes nearly 81 levels.
But as I said previously, all of the values will be customizable in a future update.

The new scale is calculated with your current level, which means that if your level is high you may grow a lot at once. If your level is low you may shrink a bit at the beginning. It will be modified in a future update.

Your character does not look older, he is simply taller. I\'ll try to add this feature in a future update.

This mod works great with Gopher\'s [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/29476] Pumping Iron [/url]

[color=red][b]Important[/b][/color]
You need SKSE version 1.6.6 or newer for this mod to work.

[color=yellow]Installation[/color]
Use the Nexus Mod Manager. Simply download and activate.
If you want to install the mod manually simply extract the data folder of the archive to your Skyrim directory.

[color=yellow]Uninstallation[/color]
If you installed with NMM, simply deactivate the mod.
If you installed manually, delete GrowingMod.esp located in your data folder.

[color=yellow]Compatibility[/color]
It should be compatible with any mod as it doesn\'t modify any vanilla game file.

[color=yellow]Future developpements[/color]
Add customization via SkyUI MCM.
Character getting old.
Character starting as a pre-adult.

[color=yellow]FAQ[/color]
Q: Does this work with both males and females?
A: Yes.

Q: Can you make it so the growth is not linear?
A: Leveling up becomes slower as you level increases, which means that the growth is not linear. You\'ll grow fast at the beginning and slow at the end. A bit like in real life.

Q: Does it affect NPC\'s? 
A: No.

[color=yellow]Thanks to[/color]
Bethesda for the game and the creation kit
Gopher for the help and the inspiration
